Package ohos.ivihardware.adas.model

Class AdasSubscription

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.adas.model.AdasSubscription

  • public class AdasSubscription
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the subscription descriptor.

    Each subscription descriptor contains the ID and subscription period of an ADAS signal. Once the subscription is successful, an AdasSubscription object is returned. You can use the returned object to unsubscribe from the specific ADAS signal.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.ADAS

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdasSubscription

        public AdasSubscription​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                        long interval)
        A constructor used to create a AdasSubscription instance based on the ID and subscription period of the specified ADAS signal.

        This method may change the subscription period (specified by interval) for periodic subscription. Specifically, the input value of interval is rounded up to a positive integer multiple of 200. For example, if the input value is 0, the actual subscription period will be 200 ms; if the input value is 201, the actual subscription period will be 400 ms.

        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the subscribed ADAS signal.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period.
        Since:
        3

      • AdasSubscription

        public AdasSubscription​()
        A no-argument constructor used to create an AdasSubscription instance.
        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getAdasPropId

        Obtains the ID of the subscribed ADAS signal.
        Returns:
        Returns the ADAS signal ID.
        Since:
        3

      • getActualInterval

        public long getActualInterval​()
        Obtains the actual subscription period.

        The actual subscription period may be different from the value of interval passed to subscription methods, such as DrivingAssistManager.subscribeAdasSignal(java.lang.String, ohos.ivihardware.adas.model.AdasSignalCallback, long) and DrivingAssistManager.subscribeBatchProperties(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, ohos.ivihardware.adas.model.AdasSignalCallback, long).

        For example, if the value is 0, the actual subscription period will be 200 ms; if the value is 201, the actual subscription period will be 400 ms; if the value is Long.MAX_VALUE, the actual subscription period will be the same as the value, indicating that aperiodic subscription will be used.

        Returns:
        Returns the actual subscription period.
        Since:
        3
